'''Bunnelby''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ホルビー''' ''Horubee'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Diggersby}} starting at level 20.

==Biology==
Bunnelby is a small, gray, rabbit-like Pokémon. It has large, gray, brown-tipped ears with pinkish fur on the inside. It has a large, gray head and large eyes with white sclera and black pupils. It has a small pink nose and gray fur that sticks out on the cheeks, along with large white teeth. Its neck is surrounded by brown fur. It has a gray body with a gray tail and small brown spots on its hind legs. Its front paws are completely gray, while its hind paws are gray with brown toes. Bunnelby's ears are strong enough to shovel dirt and chop tree roots. It tends to be nocturnal.

==In the anime==
[[File:Clemont Bunnelby.png|thumb|250px|left|Bunnelby in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Clemont's Bunnelby]]====
Bunnelby debuted in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]'', under the ownership of {{an|Clemont}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Bunnelby appeared in ''[[XY025|Climbing the Walls!]]''.

A Bunnelby appeared in a flashback or a fantasy in ''[[XY035|The Forest Champion!]]''.

A wild Bunnelby appeared in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''

Two Trainers' Bunnelby appeared in ''[[SS036|The Legend of X, Y, and Z!]]'', with one of them appearing during a flashback.

==In the manga==
[[File:Bunnelby Adventures.png|thumb|100px|Bunnelby in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Bunnelby debuted in ''[[PAXY02|X-actly What They Wanted]]'', where it was seen running with its trainer from the battle between {{p|Xerneas}} and {{p|Yveltal}}.

Another Bunnelby appeared with a female {{tc|Rising Star}} at a Mini-game Corner in the {{chap|X & Y}}.

A Bunnelby appeared in ''[[PAXY37|Zygarde Agitated]]''.

==Trivia==
* Bunnelby was designed by [[Lee HyunJung]].

===Origin===
Bunnelby is based on a rabbit. Its ability to use its ears as digging tools to excavate through earth and roots may be a reference to {{wp|trowel}}s or {{wp|shovel}}s.

====Name origin====
Bunnelby may be a combination of ''bunny'' and ''tunnel''.

Horubee may be based on 掘る ''horu'' (to dig) or ''hole''.
